intro: Convallaria majalis f. laminaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lily of the valley, is a variant of the common lily of the valley. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae, characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers. The foliage is more elongated and narrower compared to the typical variety, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade. This plant is noted for its fragrant blossoms and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
